      • formatName

        public static java.lang.String formatName(java.lang.String name)
        Formats an additional Name of an object. Checks if the name is set. If name is set, the name is packed into brackets and prepend with an whitespace
        Parameters:
        name - | optional name of an object or NULL
        Returns:
        empty string or the name of the object packed into brackets and prepend with a whitespace e.g. ' (optional name)'

      • translate

        public static java.lang.String translate(java.lang.String key,
                                         java.lang.Object... arguments)
        Try to translate a key in the localized version defined in the PropertyResourceBundle file.
        Parameters:
        key - | PropertyResourceBundle key
        arguments - | arguments that should fill the placeholder in the returned PropertyResourceBundle value
        Returns:
        a localized string for the given PropertyResourceBundle key, filled with the set arguments

      • translateN

        public static java.lang.String translateN(java.lang.String key,
                                          java.lang.Object... arguments)
        Try to translate a key in the localized version defined in the PropertyResourceBundle file. This function is optimized for differing sentences depending on the amount of results.
        Parameters:
        key - | PropertyResourceBundle key
        arguments - | arguments that should fill the placeholder in the returned PropertyResourceBundle value. The last argument gives the count and decide which value will be returned.
        Returns:
        a localized string for the given amount depending PropertyResourceBundle key, filled with the set arguments

      • formatX

        public static java.lang.String formatX(CoordinateSystem cs,
                                       double x)
        Formats the x value of a point with respect to if Pi is set in the coordinate system.
        Parameters:
        cs - the coordinate system
        x - x-value
        Returns:
        formated string for the point

      • formatY

        public static java.lang.String formatY(CoordinateSystem cs,
                                       double y)
        Formats the y value of a point.
        Parameters:
        cs - the coordinate system
        y - y-value
        Returns:
        formated string for the point

      • formatForSpeech

        public static java.lang.String formatForSpeech(CoordinateSystem cs,
                                               Point point)
        Formats a Point that it is optimized for speech output. E.g. (x / y)
        Parameters:
        cs - the coordinate system
        point - The point that should be transformed into a textual representation
        Returns:
        formated string for the point with '/' as delimiter

      • formatForText

        public static java.lang.String formatForText(CoordinateSystem cs,
                                             Point point,
                                             java.lang.String cap)
        Formats a Point that it is optimized for textual output and packed into the caption with brackets. E.g. E(x | y)
        Parameters:
        cs - the coordinate system
        point - The point that should be transformed into a textual representation
        cap - The caption string without brackets
        Returns:
        formated string for the point with '/' as delimiter if now caption is set, otherwise packed in the caption with brackets and the '|' as delimiter

      • getFunctionName

        public static java.lang.String getFunctionName(int f)
        Try to translate the function index into a continuous literal starting with the char 'f'. If the given index is not valid it returns the name as a combination of 'f' + the given number.
        Parameters:
        f - | the index if the function
        Returns:
        a literal representation to the given function index e.g. 'f', 'g', 'h' or 'f1000'.

        public static java.lang.String getPointName(int p)
